title: Uttarakhand: मॉनसून ने फिर ली करवट, आज कई जिलों में भारी बारिश की चेतावनी - Agniban
article_text: इंदौर : अय्याशी की हद, दरिंदों ने बीच सडक़ से युवती को उठाया, मुजरा करवाया, अप्राकृतिक कृत्य और गैंगरेप भी Indore: The height of debauchery, the brutes picked up the girl from the middle of the road, made her dance, did unnatural acts इंदौर : अय्याशी की हद, दरिंदों ने बीच सडक़ से युवती को उठाया, मुजरा करवाया, अप्राकृतिक कृत्य और गैंगरेप भी Agniban

title: LoP Sharma visits cloudburst-hit Rajgarh, assures support to affected - Rising Kashmir
article_text:
Rising Kashmir > Blog > Politics > LoP Sharma visits cloudburst-hit Rajgarh, assures support to affected
POLITICS
LoP Sharma visits cloudburst-hit Rajgarh, assures support to affected
Last updated: September 13, 2025 1:07 am
RK News
Published: September 13, 2025
Share
2 Min Read
SHARE
Follow us on

Jammu, Sept 11: In the aftermath of the tragic cloudburst that struck Rajgarh in Ramban district on August 30, claiming five lives and leaving several families devastated, the Leader of the Opposition (LoP), Sunil Sharma, visited the affected area to express solidarity with the victims and assess ongoing relief efforts.

The cloudburst had resulted in sudden flash floods and mudslides, causing extensive damage to homes, farmlands, and infrastructure. The natural calamity has left the local community in mourning and in urgent need of support.

During his visit,  Sharma met with the bereaved families, offered heartfelt condolences, and assured them of every possible kind of assistance to help them recover from the tragedy. “We stand firmly with every family affected by this disaster”, he said.

Sharma said the government must ensure swift and adequate relief, and assured that he will personally follow up to see that promises are fulfilled.

He was accompanied by senior district administration officials, police officers, and local BJP leaders, who briefed him on the current status of rescue, relief, and rehabilitation operations. Sunil Sharma urged authorities to expedite compensation for the victims and ensure timely rehabilitation for displaced families.

The BJP leader also interacted with local residents and social workers, political leaders, listening to their grievances and suggestions regarding the restoration of basic services like water, electricity, road connectivity, and education infrastructure disrupted by the disaster.

Highlighting the need for better preparedness in vulnerable hilly regions, Sharma stressed the importance of installing early warning systems and strengthening disaster response mechanisms to prevent such losses in the future. He called upon both the UT administration and the central government to extend all necessary support to rebuild the affected areas.

The LoP emphasised that long-term rehabilitation, including livelihood restoration and psychosocial support, must be prioritised to ensure a complete recovery. He reaffirmed his commitment to standing by the people of Rajgarh and ensuring that their voices are heard at every level of government.
